sub_title: Project Management and Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist I Partnerships I Reporting I Communications I Research I Digital Marketing I Social Media Management I
summary:
As an accomplished Programme, Partnership, Communications, Reporting and Monitoring & Evaluation Specialist, I bring a wealth of experience and expertise in project development, management, reporting and administration. With a successful track record spanning over 10 years, I have worked across critical areas such as gender equality, youth empowerment, social justice, climate change, human rights, peacebuilding, and governance. In addition, I have a master's in Development Studies and a bachelor's in International Relations. Throughout my career, I have effectively implemented and managed diverse donor-funded projects on behalf of prestigious organizations including the EU, SIDA, USAID, JAPAN, and DFID (FCDO) across Sub-Saharan Africa and Europe.

My extensive experience has equipped me with valuable supervisory and managerial skills, which I have further refined through relevant training in project management, report writing, development communications, data analytics, and social media marketing. In my most recent role as the Programme/Partnership and M&E officer at United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), I had the privilege of overseeing and managing the partnership and monitoring and evaluation components of over 29-million-dollar EU-UN initiative known as the Spotlight Initiative. This initiative aims to bridge gender gaps and combat violence against women on a national scale, Police Reform Project and many others. Additionally, I took charge of the reporting component for the National Police Reform Project, a significant endeavour worth over 2 million dollars, which supports the Nigerian authorities in building a more efficient and professional police service.

One of my notable strengths is my ability to operate in remote and high-security risk locations, as well as coordinate efforts in various office settings. These experiences have not only honed my interpersonal skills but have also provided me with a deep understanding of intercultural dynamics, gained through studying and working across both Europe and Africa.

Moreover, I am well-versed in several technologies and methodologies crucial to the field, such as Quantum, Microsoft Office 365, Teams, SharePoint, Google Docs, Zoom, Meta Social Media Marketing and Management Certification, Power BI, Microsoft Project, Excel, Scrum/Agile and Crowdfunding.

projects.title: United Nations Spotlight Initiative
projects.description: an EU-UN global, multiyear signature initiative focused on eliminating all forms of violence against women and girls (VAWG). The initiative is so named as it brings focused attention to the issue, moving it into the spotlight and placing at the centre of efforts to achieve gender equality and women’s empowerment, in line with the 2030 agenda for sustainable development goals.

profile_positions.description:
- Develop Project’s Results Framework, prepare M&E Plan and monitor progress in achieving project outcomes, including through producing tools for collection of data (such as perception surveys), collecting baseline data and implementation data, and undertaking field visits.

- Represent UNDP in the quarterly M&E visit to project states, strengthens partners' capacity on reporting, review partner's reports and provide technical feedback to enhance the quality of output and outcome reporting.

- Organize and undertake training collaborating with partners on M&E as required.

- Check data quality with partners, collect data on a regular basis to measure achievement against the performance indicators.

- Coordinate and lead on documentation and reporting on programme activities, creating impact stories, writing quarterly progress, annual, and donor reports etc.

- Identify lessons learned and develop case studies to capture qualitative outputs of the project. Provide advice to the supervisor on improving project performance using M&E findings.
profile_positions.title: Partnership, Reporting and M&E Officer (EU Funded Project)

profile_positions.description:
- Managing partnership, administration, reporting, and monitoring & evaluation component of the UNDP EU - UN Spotlight Initiative – which focused on ending all forms of violence against women and girls globally.

- Provide technical and administrative support in the day-day nationwide implementation of the Spotlight Initiative project to ensure quality delivery of project outputs and outcomes in accordance with the annual work plans and project documents in collaboration with 5 other UN Agencies in Nigeria.

- Manage relationships, and maintain effective partnerships relations with national authorities, civil society groups and other relevant partners for ownership and sustainability.

- Administrative Support: Provide general administrative support, including managing calendars, meetings, organizing travel arrangements, and workshops etc.

- Strengthen knowledge production and analysis in the Spotlight Initiative; ensure internal and external knowledge sharing: streamline knowledge management activities in annual work plans and significantly participate in the quarterly project monitoring, evaluation, reporting and data collection. 

- Document results achieved, lessons-learnt to reflect process issues, and recommendations for similar future projects/ activities after each of the project activities conducted by the project team.

- Manage documentation on the project, draft talking points, and sharing of success stories and failures, and promising practices through concrete and in-depth analytical case studies, that support the advancement of women and girls in Nigeria.

- Coordinate and manage all project-related reporting, which includes the quarterly progress report, annual reports, and project management dashboard in UNDP Atlas software and Quantum. 

-Maintain updated and comprehensive evidence of all project activities and project result framework with performance indicators.

- Contracting: preparing IP contracts, review budgets and grant applications etc.
profile_positions.title: Programme/Partnership - Gender & Human Right Team

profile_positions.description:
Program Officer (Ready To Run) - Ready To Run is a movement dedicated to inspiring young men and women to run for office. Ready To Run was borne out of the Not Too Young To Run campaign. With Ready To Run, we want to make a statement that young people can demonstrate excellent public leadership with immense capacity to address Africa’s governance challenges.

Duties and Achievements                                                                                     
- Provided technical and administrative support in the day-to-day implementation of the #ReadyToRun and the #NotTooYoungToRun global advocacy campaign activities and social movement in Nigeria between 2016 and 2018, which successfully pushed for the review of sections 65, 106, 131 and 177 of the 1999 Nigerian rigid constitution and lowering the constitutional age for contesting elections, ultimately leading to the bill being passed by the National Assembly and later assented by the President.

•	Demonstrated a strong commitment to inclusion by ensuring that young women, youth, and persons living with disabilities (PLWDs) were methodologically included in all project phases from an age, gender, and diversity perspective. Collaborated with team members to organize marches, workshops, training, and advocacy visits, crafted advocacy messages, and managed young aspirants registered to run for election on our website.

- Successfully organized capacity-building training for youth candidates that ran for different public offices, leading to the emergence of 100 youth candidates with a record number after the 2019 general elections in Nigeria.

- Conducted extensive research, wrote opinion articles, and managed the project website and social media channels, resulting in increased engagement and visibility for the organization and the campaign.
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer

profile_positions.description:
- Supported the development of the UNOY report and Policy brief "Mapping the Progress of Youth, Peace and Security in the EU report funded by SIDA. 
- Successfully organized and coordinate 3 UNOY advocacy missions to the UN, AU and EU.
- Weekly monitoring of global and regional policy developments on youth, peace and security, with a specific focus on the UN, African Union and European Union.
- Provided technical support in the day-to-day management of UNOY’s European and African advocacy teams, including the facilitation of online meetings and strategy development.
- Wrote high-quality reports to donors and policy briefs in collaboration with colleagues and network members.
- Help in the coordination of the Global Coalition on Youth, Peace, Security and the GPPAC Working Group on Youth, Peace, and Security. 
- Assist in the administration of Youth, Peace and Security GPPAC micro-grant
- Produce, edit and publish online content for UNOY website and social media channels.
- Managed and Maintained good relations with both external and internal donors and partners.
profile_positions.title: Advocacy and Communication Officer

profile_positions.description:
- Spearheaded WYF's youth engagement strategies by collaborating with youth-led organizations affiliated with UN-DPI on advocacy and outreach initiatives, resulting in increased youth participation in critical global issues.

- Planned and executed several international workshops and conferences addressing pressing global issues affecting youth and children, providing opportunities for youth to learn, network and engage with experts and policymakers.

- Drafted persuasive project proposals and efficiently monitored and reported all aspects of active projects and programs, ensuring successful implementation and achievement of desired outcomes.

- Collaborated with focal point networks across Africa, providing support and coordination to ensure effective advocacy and outreach activities.
profile_positions.title: Focal Point/UNDPI Youth Representative

company.name: Hold My Hands Women & Youth Development Foundation

profile_positions.company: Hold My Hands Women & Youth Development Foundation
profile_positions.description:
•	Oversees the design, development, and implementation of the Youth4peace and gender Based Violence community projects which has directly benefited over 2,000 male and female youths across Nigeria.
•	Organized and felicitated training for key stakeholders on SRHR, FGM, Youth, Peace and Security online and offline in 5 states in Nigeria.
•	Actively contributed to the development of the program monitoring and evaluation tools. 
•	Oversaw program budget and reporting in alignment with donor’s regulations. 
•	Coordinator monthly online and offline campaign on YPS and countering violent extremism

PROGRAM OBJECTIVE

Our programs focus on uniting young people against early child marriage, Female Genital Mutilations (FGM/C), Gender-Based Violence, violent extremism and radicalization through school-based mentorship, training and community-based advocacy across Nigeria.
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Market Expansion & Lead Generation: Provided day-to-day management and personalized financial advisory services to our esteemed bank retail customers, identifying potential partnerships and business opportunities.
•	Customer Due Diligence: Conducted thorough due diligence on new and existing customers to verify their identities, assess their risk profiles, and determine the legitimacy of their business activities and data.
•	KYC Documentation: Reviewed and validated customer documentation, such as identification proofs, business registrations, and other relevant records, to ensure accuracy and compliance with internal policies and regulatory guidelines.
•	Client Relationship Management: Built and maintained strong relationships with bank customers which has earned me recognition, having won 3 awards for exceptional interpersonal skills and a track record of attracting fixed deposits, loan sales while retaining a substantial balance sheet worth 5 million euros for an impressive 4 years. 
•	Market Research and Analysis: Conducted market research to identify potential areas for business expansion and assessing market trends and competitor activities. 
•	Proposal Development: Designed proposals to potential clients, outlining the benefits of partnering with the bank for their financial needs.
•	Loan Sales, Recovery and Risk Mitigation: Analysed and screened credit facility and loan applications ensure prudent risk management while facilitating seamless loan processing, analysis, tracking, and recovery.  
•	Business Networking: Represented the bank in different high-level events, effectively marketing our offerings, and attracting new customers and funds to bolster our growth and success. Contributed to the bank's success by assisting in the preparation of comprehensive weekly management reports, etc.
•	Compliance and Risk Management: Ensured that all business development activities comply with regulatory requirements and align with the bank's risk management policies.
profile_positions.title: Business Development and KYC Analyst

volunteer_experiences.description:
1. Through personal fundraising initiative, I successfully completed a borehole water project at the Government College Community in Lafia Local Government Council which provided potable water to the whole school and neighbouring community for the first time.

2. Carried out weekly community-based development projects in Nasarawa State, and helped in the supervision of MDGs community projects in the State.

3. Planted over 1000 trees in four schools in Lafia and flowers at Government college Lafia as adaptation measure for climate change in the state with the support of NESRA.

5. Weekly sensitization's about of community leaders on environmental protection and climate action in partnership with the Nigerian National Environmental Protection Agency (NESRA).
This project empowers young women to use technology for social and economic development worldwide.

company.name: UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network – Youth

volunteer_experiences.description: Promoting the new SDGs Goal's Worldwide both online and offline.

1. We are a forum of youths with different skills that belong to different sectors and organizations who come together with a simple common goal; to be a part of the solution to the numerous issues Nigeria faces, monitor project implementation and influence WB policies, while we also develop ourselves through opportunities available of which some of them originate from the World Bank.
President Obama's initiative which aimed to discover, educate and empower young African youth leaders across Africa to be a positive change in local communities.

•	Building partnerships, relationship management, planning and implementing YALI monthly meeting, mentorship series and other community service and engagements that have impacted above 100,000 young people across Nigeria.
•	Implemented a good governance and accountability project in 5 states in Nigeria with support from the US embassy, Nigeria.  This role demands collaboration with the U.S. Embassy in Abuja and management of young leaders from different ethnic groups and religious backgrounds across Nigeria.
•	Connected young Nigerian leaders to each other and with resources provided by the U.S. government at yali.state.gov.
- During my leadership at YALI Network Face2face Abuja, we connected young Nigerian leaders to each other and with resources provided by the U.S. government at yali.state.gov. We have successfully laid a foundation and expanded the network to almost the whole of Nigeria afterwards.

- Promoted My World UN post-2015 Global Survey and create awareness of the campaign online and offline.
- Advocated and championed the post-2015 citizen's engagement discussions worldwide (SDGs project) both online and offline.
- Worked with 27 international volunteers across the globe in defining the new development agenda (SDGs) for the world which will replace the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) in 2015.
